popt4jlib.GradientDescent

Class VecUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.GradientDescent.VecUtil

  • public class VecUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for Vector computations.

    Note:

    • 2018-11-16: modified getEuclideanDistance(x,y) to work with popt4jlib.DblArray1SparseVector data faster (when both arguments are sparse).
    • 2018-11-09: modified innerProduct(x,y) to work with sparse data faster. Also modified all methods not to declare the (unchecked) exceptions they may throw when passed illegal arguments.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2018

    Company:

    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      static VectorIntf add(VectorIntf x, VectorIntf y)

      returns the center of a collection of VectorIntf objects.

      • equal

        public static boolean equal(VectorIntf x,
                            VectorIntf y)
        checks if the two argument vectors have all their components equal. Faster only if both arguments are DblArray1SparseVector.
        Parameters:
        x - VectorIntf
        y - VectorIntf
        Returns:
        boolean true iff all the components of the vectors x and y are equal (so that for each component i, the comparison Double.compare(xi,yi)==0 returns true). Returns false immediately if the two vectors have different lengths
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if x & y are both null. Not checked.

      • getCenter

        public static VectorIntf getCenter(java.util.Collection vectors)
        returns the center of a collection of VectorIntf objects.
        Parameters:
        vectors - Collection
        Returns:
        VectorIntf
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the collection is null, empty or if it contains vectors of varying dimensions. Not checked though.

      • getEuclideanDistance

        public static double getEuclideanDistance(DblArray1SparseVector x,
                                          DblArray1SparseVector y)
        returns the Euclidean distance between two DblArray1SparseVector sparse vectors. When both x and y are sparse, speed up the computations by not calling the expensive getCoord(i) on default-valued coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - DblArray1SparseVector
        y - DblArray1SparseVector
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any arg is null or if the two args dimensions differ. Exception is not checked.

      • getEuclideanDistance

        public static double getEuclideanDistance(VectorIntf x,
                                          VectorIntf y)
        returns the Euclidean distance between two VectorIntf objects.
        Parameters:
        x - VectorIntf
        y - VectorIntf
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any arg is null or if the two args dimensions differ. Exception is not checked.

      • getCosineSimilarityDistance

        public static double getCosineSimilarityDistance(VectorIntf x,
                                                 VectorIntf y)
        return the cosine-similarity between x and y (ie the cos(x/\y)) used in Information Retrieval. This similarity measure is not a "distance" measure, as the more "similar" two vectors are, the greater the returned value of this method.
        Parameters:
        x - VectorIntf
        y - VectorIntf
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if x or y are null or if one of the two is the zero vector, or if the two vectors' dimensions don't agree. Not checked though.

      • getJaccardDistance

        public static double getJaccardDistance(VectorIntf x,
                                        VectorIntf y)
        return the Jaccard distance measure between two vectors. Also known as the Tanimoto distance measure (used in Information Retrieval, Recommender Systems etc.)
        Parameters:
        x - VectorIntf
        y - VectorIntf
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any argument is null or if dimensions don't match. Not checked though.
